the O
fact O
that O
data O
was O
available O
only O
to O
20 O
and O

GPa O
, O
respectively O
. O

INTRODUCTION O

progress O
in O

of O

( O

) O

( O

) O

. O

was O
analyzed O
by O
calculating O
the O
formation O
energies O
and O
phonon O
dispersion O
curves O
. O

section 14
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/dev/18-09-2019-paper-12.pdf.json
The O
most O
stable O
are O
variants O
B O
and O
C O
with O
pure O
Fe O
and O
mixed O
Fe O
- O
Si O
interface O
layers O
, O
respectively O
. O

section 14
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/dev/18-09-2019-paper-12.pdf.json
Variant O
B O
shows O
full O
dynamical O
stability O
. O

section 14
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/dev/18-09-2019-paper-12.pdf.json
Configuration O
D O
is O
dynamically O
unstable O
and O
has O
the O
lowest O
binding O
energy O
. O

section 14
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/dev/18-09-2019-paper-12.pdf.json
However O
, O
we O
cannot O
rule O
out O
the O
stabilization O
of O
any O
variant O
at O
finite O
temperature O
, O
as O
the O
DFT O
calculations O
correspond O
to O
T O
= O
0 O
K O
. O
Relatively O
small O
differences O
between O
the O
formation O
energies O
of O
the O
studied O
systems O
also O
indicate O
that O
all O
variants O
may O
be O
observed O
. O

section 14
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/dev/18-09-2019-paper-12.pdf.json
We O
studied O
the O
influence O
of O
the O
interface O
on O
magnetization O
and O
charge O
distribution O
. O

section 14
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/dev/18-09-2019-paper-12.pdf.json
We O
found O
a O
transfer O
of O
electrons O
from O
the O
first O
Fe O
- O
Si O
or O
Fe O
layer O
into O
the O
substrate O
GaAs O
layer O
, O
reducing O
electron O
localization O
in O
the O
interface O
areas O
. O

section 14
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/dev/18-09-2019-paper-12.pdf.json
We O
have O
used O
two O
different O
methods O
for O
calculating O
magnetic O
moments O
and O
obtained O
consistently O
very O
similar O
values O
for O
the O
Fe O
atoms O
. O

section 14
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/dev/18-09-2019-paper-12.pdf.json
In O
the O
first O
layer O
from O
the O
interface O
, O
they O
are O
enhanced O
in O
comparison O
with O
bulk O
Fe3Si O
, O
and O
the O
strongest O
effect O
is O
found O
in O
the O
pure O
Fe O
layers O
in O
variants O
B O
and O
D O
. O
Calculations O
with O
magnetic O
moments O
fixed O
along O
different O
axes O
showed O
that O
the O
energetically O
favorable O
direction O
of O
magnetization O
is O
the O
[110] O
direction O
of O
the O
Fe3Si O
crystallographic O
unit O
cell O
, O
in O
agreement O
with O
experimental O
results O
. O

section 14
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/dev/18-09-2019-paper-12.pdf.json
Moreover O
, O
we O
demonstrate O
that O
both O
a O
tetragonal O
distortion O
and O
an O
interaction O
with O
the O
substrate O
are O
responsible O
for O
the O
magnetic O
moments O
alignment O
. O

section 14
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/dev/18-09-2019-paper-12.pdf.json

electronic O
densities O
of O
states O
projected O
on O

and O

atoms O

of O
spectra O
calculated O
for O
atoms O
in O
close O

to O
the O

. O

section 14
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/dev/18-09-2019-paper-12.pdf.json

changes O
observed O
for O

- O
down O
states O
at O
the O
Fermi O
energy O
affect O
the O
spin O
polarization O
. O

section 14
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/dev/18-09-2019-paper-12.pdf.json

configurations O
A O
and O

, O
the O
spin O
polarization O
at O

energy O
is O
larger O
than O
the O

value O
for O

. O

section 14
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/dev/18-09-2019-paper-12.pdf.json

supports O

. O

id data_09-04-2020/fold5/dev/04-09-2019-paper-27.pdf.json

- O
initio O
calculations O
are O
performed O
to O

the O

- O

of O

, O

at O
x1⁄40 O
. O
25 O
. O

section ABSTRACT
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/dev/04-09-2019-paper-27.pdf.json
From O
the O
calculated O
results O
of O
band O
structure O
and O
density O
of O
states O
, O
the O
half O
- O

and O

state O
for O

xCoxTe O

are O

. O

section ABSTRACT
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/dev/04-09-2019-paper-27.pdf.json
It O
is O
found O
that O
the O
tetrahedral O
crystal O
field O
gives O
rise O
to O
triple O
degeneracy O
t2g O
and O
double O
degeneracy O
eg O
. O

section ABSTRACT
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/dev/04-09-2019-paper-27.pdf.json

, O

predict O
the O
values O
of O
spin O
- O

( O

section ABSTRACT
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/dev/04-09-2019-paper-27.pdf.json

section TITLE
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/dev/09-02-2020-1210.8372v1.Electronic_Strengthening_of_Graphene_by_Charge_Doping.pdf.json
Electronic O
Strengthening O
of O
Graphene B-MATERIAL
by O
Charge O
Doping O

section ABSTRACT
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/dev/09-02-2020-1210.8372v1.Electronic_Strengthening_of_Graphene_by_Charge_Doping.pdf.json
Graphene B-MATERIAL
is O
known O
as O
the O
strongest O
2D O
material O
in O
nature O
, O
yet O
we O
show O
that O
moderate O
charge O
doping O
of O
either O
electrons O
or O
holes O
can O
further O
enhance O
its O
ideal O
strength O
by O
up O
to O
∼17% O
, O
based O

values O

. O

id data_09-04-2020/fold5/dev/04-09-2019-paper-28.pdf.json
The O
dEg/dP O
value O
was O
39 O
. O
8 O
meV/GPa O
for O
CdSe O
QD O
and O
–14 O
. O
3 O
meV/GPa O
for O
PbSe O
QD O
. O

section 5
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/dev/04-09-2019-paper-28.pdf.json
These O
values O
were O
qualitatively O
similar O
to O
the O
corresponding O
bulk O
values O
of O
+42 O
. O
0 O
and O
–56 O
. O
9 O
meV/GP O
, O
respectively O
. O

section 5
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/dev/04-09-2019-paper-28.pdf.json
The O
absolute O
magnitude O
of O
dEg/dP O
was O
smaller O
for O
the O
PbSe O
QD O
than O
bulk O
. O

section 5
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/dev/04-09-2019-paper-28.pdf.json
In O
contrast O
, O
the O
temperature O
dependence O
of O
the O
band O
gap O
differed O
significantly O
for O
the O
QDs O
and O
bulk O
, O
especially O
for O
PbSe O
, O
where O
dEg/dT O
had O
opposite O
signs O
. O

section 5
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/dev/04-09-2019-paper-28.pdf.json
To O
rationalize O
this O
finding O
, O
a O
simple O
model O
was O
proposed O
using O
two O
alternative O
descriptions O
of O
the O
confinement O
energy O
. O

section 5
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/dev/04-09-2019-paper-28.pdf.json
The O
change O
of O
the O
sign O
was O
explained O
by O
the O
temperature O
dependence O
of O
the O
effective O
mass O
in O
PbSe O
. O

section 5
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/dev/04-09-2019-paper-28.pdf.json
Thus O
, O
the O
simulations O
provided O
an O
ab O
initio O
proof O
of O
the O
analytic O
models O
. O

section 5
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/dev/04-09-2019-paper-28.pdf.json
The O
pure O
- O
dephasing/decoherence O
times O
between O
several O
experimentally O
relevant O
electronic O
state O
pairs O
were O
computed O
using O
optical O
response O
theory O
and O
ab O
initio O
MD O
. O

section 5
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/dev/04-09-2019-paper-28.pdf.json
Linear O
temperature O
dependence O
was O
found O
for O
both O
QDs O
. O

section 5
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/dev/04-09-2019-paper-28.pdf.json
The O
relative O
order O
of O
the O
decoherence O
times O
for O
the O
selected O
state O
pairs O
was O
similar O
to O
the O
order O
found O
in O
our O
previous O

of O
the O
PbSe O
QD O
at O
T O
) O
300 O
K O
. O
The O
main O
advantage O

our O
study O
is O
the O
first O
- O
principle O

of O
the O
electronic O
states O
and O

coupling O
. O

section 5
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/dev/04-09-2019-paper-28.pdf.json
The O
simulation O
explicitly O
includes O
QD O
chemical O
and O
physical O
properties O
, O
which O
are O
not O
included O
in O
the O
analytic O

, O

close O

attention O
. O

section 5
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/dev/04-09-2019-paper-28.pdf.json

the O

of O

surface O

. O

section ABSTRACT
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/dev/09-02-2020-1504.02770v3.Density_Functional_Theory_Meta_GGA_U_Study_of_Water_Incorporation_in_the_Metal_Organic_Framework_Material_Cu_BTC.pdf.json
Water O
absorption O
in O
the O
metal O
- O
organic O
framework O
( O
MOF O
) O
material O
Cu B-MATERIAL
- I-MATERIAL
BTC I-MATERIAL
, O
up O
to O
a O
